column5: I really want to take my buddy who is turning 40  fishing tomorrow. However, the niagara looks a little dirty right now - like 1-2' visibility:(  I was wondering if fishing the shoreline in my boat near Dalhousie or Jordan harbour would be a good option and I don't know if there is an ice free launch near Jordan harbour.  Any advice or ideas would be great appreciated.  Thanks Landry
Heard the mudline is quite big and the water temps are just above freezing..   A few guys on spoonpullers have been out and skunked.   I'd be waiting if it were me.
Darn. Thanks Bill. I really want to get out but who doesn't after this winter.
Yeah, you and me both man...  I can't wait to pull the boat down to Port D and troll around Weller for browns/lakers/whatever.   I've got a new planner board setup I'm dying to get wet!

Had to run to St  Kitts this morning, there was some empty trailers at Jordan and a half a dozen boats working the outflow. Lake was pretty flat and the mudline was in close to shore, maybe a 100 yds of muddy water till you hit the clearer stuff.

Had to run to St  Kitts this morning, there was some empty trailers at Jordan and a half a dozen boats working the outflow. Lake was pretty flat and the mudline was in close to shore, maybe a 100 yds of muddy water till you hit the clearer stuff.  Good news, all this sun should get the browns going
I should have just gone. Darn again.

I should have just gone. Darn again.  Would gave been a decent day, less than 6" ripple and was 60F here today at my place, 100 yds from the lake.  edit: there is a webcam at 50 PT that gives a good shot of the lake conditions if that is any help.   http://www.fpyc.ca/webcam/default.php
